result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Philip W. Anderson was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript Plea/sentencing hearing 5-31-18
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Philip W. Anderson in court with attorney James McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  no additions or corrections to the PSI by either parties.  DE will plead to OWI 7th - 3 yrs in - 1 1/2 years in and 2 yrs ES - 11 days credit time served.  DE entered plea of NC.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds DE guilty and count 2 is dismissed.  Defendant addressed the Court.  Court advised the court officer to notify the jail staff that the defendant has medical issues and needs to have his medication as directed by doctor and is allowed to take medication to jail with him.

Court:   5 years prison / 3 years in prison with 11 days credit time served - 2 years of extended supervision - $100.00 fine plus costs - bond to be applied balance returned to poster - dl revoked 36 months - IID 36 months - AODA and follow thru 
  eligible for  substance abuse progarm

Defendant Philip W. Anderson in court with attorney James McLaughlin. Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty McL states this is a 7th OWI.  State recites plea - prison 3 yrs in and 3 yrs ES - DL revoked 2 yrs. - costs.  Court questions Atty McL re: PSI.  Atty McL has no objection to PSI.  Court makes stmt.  matter will be rescheduled - Court long form PSI - no agent need appear  - bond will continue  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 31, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
